newsitem.title: ITALY: Specialists bid for 97 bln lire of Italy 3-yr Btp.
newsitem.headline: Specialists bid for 97 bln lire of Italy 3-yr Btp.

text.p: Specialist bond traders bid for 97 billion lire of three-year fixed-rate bonds (BTP) against the Italian Treasury's offer of 150 billion lire of paper.
Earlier, the Treasury received bids for 4.48 trillion lire at the open auction for the May 15, 2000 paper, against 1.5 trillion lire worth of bonds on offer, and the auction price was set at 99.95.
Specialist bond traders also bid for 302 billion lire of five year Btps compared with 200 billion lire worth on offer.
At the open auction earlier, the Treasury received bids for 3.087 trillion lire of paper against 2.0 trillion on offer and the auction price was set at 100.35.
